channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tanzanian opposition decries 'sham' elections, alleges hundreds of deaths
item.description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan sworn in for a second term amid disputed 98% win, deadly protests, and an information blackout.

item.title: Huggies maker Kimberly-Clark is buying Tylenol maker Kenvue
item.description: One of the biggest mergers of the year, worth $49 billion, comes just weeks after the Trump administration linked the common painkiller to autism, whi...

item.title: Public workers could be denied loan forgiveness if cities defy Trump, lawsuit alleges
item.description: A new lawsuit argues the latest changes to Public Service Loan Forgiveness could exclude public servants whose organizations have resisted President T...

item.title: Nearly 400,000 people are starving in Sudan, a new report finds
item.description: The war involving the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces has created the world's largest humanitarian disaster, a leading hunger agency says. The major...

item.title: SNAP benefits will restart, but will be half the normal payment and delayed
item.description: About 1 in 8 U.S. residents get an average of $187 a month per person in the food assistance known as SNAP. For the first time, the Trump administrati...

item.title: Guinea's coup leader enters presidential race
item.description: Col Mamadi Doumbouya has broken his promise to hand power to a civilian government.

item.title: Watch: Moment train collides with lorry carrying vehicles
item.description: According to police in Texas, the truck was transporting a full load of cars when it stopped on the railroad tracks.

item.title: How much does a $75,000 home equity loan cost monthly following the Fed's October rate cut?
item.description: Need to borrow $75,000? Here's how much a home equity loan of this size will cost after the October Fed rate cut.

item.title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-nominated actress and mother of Laura Dern, dies at 89
item.description: Diane Ladd, the actor known for her Oscar-nominated roles in "Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore," "Wild at Heart," and "Rambling Rose" has died.

item.title: Watch: Moment medieval tower partially collapses in Rome
item.description: The partial collapse of the Torre dei Conti - close to the Colosseum - has trapped one man and left another critically injured.

item.title: Agony for families as landslide death toll climbs in Uganda and Kenya
item.description: More than 40 people are known to have died since last week, according to officials.

item.title: Obama stops short of endorsing Zohran Mamdani as New York City mayoral race winds down
item.description: Former President Barack Obama has praised Zohran Mamdani's campaign for New York City mayor, but he's stopped short of endorsing him. CBS News politic...

item.title: From the archives: Diane Ladd and Laura Dern
item.description: Three-time Oscar-nominated actress Diane Ladd, who appeared with her daughter Laura Dern in several productions (including "Rambling Rose" and "Wild a...

item.title: ChatGPT owner OpenAI signs $38bn cloud computing deal with Amazon
item.description: The seven-year agreement will see OpenAI gain access to Nvidia graphics processors to train its artificial intelligence models.

item.title: Thune says he's "optimistic" about ending government shutdown this week
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune said he's "optimistic" about ending the government shutdown this week. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Trump administration says SNAP will be partially funded in November
item.description: President Donald Trump’s administration says it will partially fund the SNAP food aid program in November after two federal judges required the paymen...

item.title: Hearings to focus on National Guard deployments in the nation’s capital and Memphis, Tennessee
Judge again bars Trump administration from deploying troops to Portland
